alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:26PM CDT until June 02 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTY... At 425 PM CDT, a confirmed landspout tornado was located a few miles north of Aurora, or 17 miles east of Grand Island, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...TORNADO. SOURCE...Emergency management confirmed weak tornado. IMPACT...Expect damage to mobile homes, roofs, and vehicles. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Hamilton County. This Warning no longer includes the community of Aurora. TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
